feat.name: Butterfly Blade Dedication
feat.access: Defeat a member of the Butterfly Blades in a sanctioned bout (page 59).
entries: You become trained in {@skill Deception} and {@skill Stealth}; if you were already trained, you become an expert instead. Whenever your proficiency rank in any weapon increases to expert or beyond, you also gain that new proficiency rank with butterfly swords. You gain access to butterfly swords (page 76).
feat.special: You cannot select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from this archetype.

feat.name: Butterfly's Kiss
entries: You can make nonlethal Strikes with a butterfly sword without taking a penalty.

feat.name: Butterfly's Sting
entries: You gain the sneak attack class feature (Core Rulebook 181)
You don't increase the number of dice as you gain levels.

feat.name: Cross The Threshold
entries: You can cast {@spell ethereal jaunt} as an occult innate spell once per day. You don't need to Sustain the Spell; instead, it lasts for 10 minutes or until you choose to return to your material form as a free action.

feat.name: Deadly Butterfly
entries: You gain access to the butterfly sword's critical specialization effect. If you already had access to the critical specialization effect or you gain the effect at a later time, you also gain the critical specialization effect for knives when you critically hit with a butterfly sword. You can benefit from only one critical specialization effect at a time.

feat.name: Disrupting Strikes
entries: You call forth positive energy from within to help you destroy undead. Your weapon and unarmed Strikes gain the effects of a disrupting property rune until the start of your next turn.
If you're 14th level or higher, your Strikes instead gain the effects of a greater disrupting property rune. The DC for the rune's effect is equal to your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher.

feat.name: Entwined Energy Ki
entries: You can transform your inner power into a type of energy to empower your ki abilities. When you gain this feat, choose either acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic damage. When you cast {@spell ki blast} (Core Rulebook 401), you can choose to have the spell deal the type of damage you chose instead of force damage. When you cast {@spell ki form|APG} (Advanced Player's Guide 229) or ki strike (Core Rulebook 401), add the type of damage you chose to the list of damage types you can select for the spell.
feat.special: At the GM's discretion, this feat can alter other ki spells.

feat.name: Ghost Eater Dedication
entries: You have trained as a ghost eater, a hunter specialized in the destruction of spirits. You know how to channel your own spiritual energy to harm spirits. Your weapon and unarmed attack Strikes become magical. Against incorporeal creatures, they also gain the effects of a ghost touch property rune.
feat.special: You cannot select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from this archetype.

feat.name: Innocent Butterfly
entries: You know how to alter the perceptions of others. You can cast aura of the unremarkable (see page 77) once per day as an innate arcane spell. The spell uses your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher.

feat.name: Mastermind's Eye
entries: When you succeed at identifying a creature using {@action Recall Knowledge}, that creature is {@condition flat-footed} against your attacks until the start of your next turn; if you critically succeed, it's {@condition flat-footed} against your attacks for 1 minute. This feat serves as the rogue's mastermind racket (Advanced Player's Guide 134) for the purpose of meeting prerequisites.

feat.name: Reach Beyond
entries: You've learned to move your spiritual energy past yourself to attack spirits where others can't. You can make melee Strikes against incorporeal creatures that are inside solid objects as long as the object is within your reach. An incorporeal creature inside of a solid object is {@condition hidden}, requiring you to succeed at a DC {@flatDC 11} flat check when you target it. You can spend an action, which has the {@trait concentrate} trait, to focus on a creature inside of a solid object. If you do, the next melee {@action Strike} you make this turn requires you to succeed at only a DC {@flatDC 6} flat check to affect the creature.

feat.name: Syu Tak-nwa's Deadly Hair
entries: Guide 102) Your hair unarmed attack deals {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage and gains the {@trait grapple} trait.

feat.name: Syu Tak-nwa's Hexed Locks
entries: Your hair unarmed attack gains the {@trait reach} trait. You can deliver hexes through your hair.

When you successfully cast a hex focus spell that requires 2 or more actions to cast and that doesn't require a spell attack roll, if your target is within your reach, as part of the spellcasting activity you can make a hair {@action Strike} against the foe before applying {@trait any} effects of the hex. If this {@action Strike} misses, the hex has no effect.

feat.name: Syu Tak-nwa's Skillful Tresses
entries: You can expertly control your living hair and use it to perform various tasks. You can perform simple {@action Interact} actions with your hair such as opening an unlocked door or picking up objects. Your hair can't perform actions that require fingers or significant manual dexterity, including any action that would require a check to accomplish. Your hair can hold items of up to 1 Bulk, but can't Activate or attack with any items it's holding.

feat.name: Wronged Monk's Wrath
entries: You gain the wronged monk's wrath ki spell (page 77)
Increase the number of Focus Points in your focus pool by 1.
